title: SMC_ERROR (Enum)
text:
TYPE SMC_ERROR :
The enumeration
SMC_ERROR
contains all error numbers that can be returned by SoftMotion function blocks.
SMC_ErrorString
generates an error string output.

rows.Name: SMC_NO_ERROR
rows.Comment: No error

rows.Name: SMC_DI_GENERAL_COMMUNICATION_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Communication error. The fieldbus slave is no longer in
state operational.

rows.Name: SMC_DI_AXIS_ERROR
rows.Comment: Axis error

rows.Name: SMC_DI_FIELDBUS_LOST_SYNCRONICITY
rows.Comment: Fieldbus has lost synchronicity

rows.Name: SMC_DI_SWLIMITS_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Position outside of permissible range ofSWLimit

rows.Name: SMC_DI_HWLIMITS_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Hardware end switch is active

rows.Name: SMC_DI_LINEAR_AXIS_OUTOFRANGE
rows.Comment:
This error occurs if a linear axis has more than 2^15 32-bit overflows
of the position in increments

rows.Name: SMC_DI_HALT_OR_QUICKSTOP_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment: Drive statusHaltorQuickstopis not supported

rows.Name: SMC_DI_VOLTAGE_DISABLED
rows.Comment: Drive has no power

rows.Name: SMC_DI_IRREGULAR_ACTPOSITION
rows.Comment: This error is no longer used

rows.Name: SMC_DI_POSITIONLAGERROR
rows.Comment:
Position lag error. Difference between set and current
position exceeds the given limit

rows.Name: SMC_DI_HOMING_ERROR
rows.Comment: Homing error reported by axis

rows.Name: SMC_DI_LICENSING_ERROR
rows.Comment: A problem with the license occurred

rows.Name: SMC_DI_DRIVE_LIMIT_ACTIVE
rows.Comment:
A limit of the drive is active, for example an iÂ²t error has
occurred.

rows.Name: SMC_REGULATOR_OR_START_NOT_SET
rows.Comment: Controller enable not done or brake applied

rows.Name: SMC_WRONG_CONTROLLER_MODE
rows.Comment: Axis in wrong controller mode

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_ACTION_FOR_LOGICAL
rows.Comment: Invalid action at logical axis

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_IS_NOT_OPERATIONAL
rows.Comment: Axis is not operationalwCommunicationState<>100

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_NOT_FOLLOWING_SETVALUES
rows.Comment: Axis is currently not following the set values

rows.Name: SMC_FB_WASNT_CALLED_DURING_MOTION
rows.Comment:
Motion creating module has not been called again before end
of the motion

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_IS_NO_AXIS_REF
rows.Comment: Type of givenAXIS_REFvariable is notAXIS_REF

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_REF_CHANGED_DURING_OPERATION
rows.Comment:
AXIS_REFvariable has been exchanged while the module
was active.

rows.Name: SMC_FB_ACTIVE_AXIS_DISABLED
rows.Comment: Axis disabled while being moved.MC_Power.bRegulatorOn

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_NOT_READY_FOR_MOTION
rows.Comment:
Axis in its current state cannot execute a motion command, because the
axis doesnât signal currently that it follows the target values.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_ERROR_DURING_MOTION
rows.Comment: The drive reported an error during an ongoing movement.

rows.Name: SMC_FB_CALLED_FROM_WRONG_TASK
rows.Comment: The function block was called from the wrong task.

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_DISTRIBUTED_CLOCKS_SETTINGS
rows.Comment:
The distributed clock settings of the EtherCAT slave are invalid.
If both SYNC0 and SYNC1 are enabled, we expect that the SYNC0
cycle time is not greater than the SYNC1 cycle time, and that
the SYNC1 cycle time is an integer multiple of the SYNC0 cycle time.

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_TIMESTAMP
rows.Comment:
The timestamp is invalid, no actual position is available for
SMC_ETC_InterpolateAxisPosition.  Check whether the library parameter
LibParams.gc_SMC_ACT_VALUE_BUFFER_SIZE_BASE2_EXP is sufficiently
large.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_ERROR_DUE_TO_FB_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Axis error due to a severe FB error in the active motion function
block.

rows.Name: SMC_VD_MAX_VELOCITY_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Maximum velocityfMaxVelocityexceeded

rows.Name: SMC_VD_MAX_ACCELERATION_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Maximum accelerationfMaxAccelerationexceeded

rows.Name: SMC_VD_MAX_DECELERATION_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Maximum decelerationfMaxDecelerationexceeded

rows.Name: SMC_3SH_INVALID_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_3SH_MODE_NEEDS_HWLIMIT
rows.Comment: Mode requests for safety reasons use of end switches.

rows.Name: SMC_FRC_NO_FREE_HANDLE
rows.Comment: No free handle has been sent to open file.

rows.Name: SMC_MAC_INITIALIZATION_FAILED
rows.Comment:
Initialization of SMC_MultiAcyclicCommunicator not
successful

rows.Name: SMC_MAC_INVALID_TASK_HANDLE
rows.Comment: The axis has got an invalid handle

rows.Name: SMC_MAC_TOO_MANY_TASKS
rows.Comment: Too many tasks with SDO-producing axes

rows.Name: SMC_MAC_ATOMIC_ADD_FAILED
rows.Comment: Atomic add failed

rows.Name: SMC_SDO_INVALID_DATALENGTH
rows.Comment: SDO-read lead to invalid datalength (> 4)

rows.Name: SMC_SCM_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment: Mode not supported

rows.Name: SMC_SCM_AXIS_IN_WRONG_STATE
rows.Comment: In current mode, controller mode cannot be changed.

rows.Name: SMC_SCM_INTERRUPTED
rows.Comment: SMC_SetControllerModehas been interrupted byMC_Stoporerrorstop.

rows.Name: SMC_ST_WRONG_CONTROLLER_MODE
rows.Comment: Axis not in correct controller mode.  Deprecated, no longer returned bySMC_SetTorque.

rows.Name: SMC_RAG_ERROR_DURING_STARTUP
rows.Comment: Error at startup of the axis group

rows.Name: SMC_RAG_ERROR_AXIS_NOT_INITIALIZED
rows.Comment: The axis is not yet in the required state.

rows.Name: SMC_PP_WRONG_AXIS_TYPE
rows.Comment: The function block does not support virtual or logical axes.

rows.Name: SMC_PP_NUMBER_OF_ABSOLUTE_BITS_INVALID
rows.Comment:
The number of absolute bits is invalid, must be in the range
8 .. 32.

rows.Name: SMC_NEGATIVE_MODULO_PERIOD
rows.Comment: The modulo period is negative, this is not supported.

rows.Name: SMC_CGR_ZERO_VALUES
rows.Comment:
The value zero is invalid for iRatioTechUnitsNum and
dwRatioTechUnitsDenom.

rows.Name: SMC_CGR_DRIVE_POWERED
rows.Comment:
Gearing parameters must not be changed as long as the drive
is under control.

rows.Name: SMC_CGR_INVALID_POSPERIOD
rows.Comment:
Invalid modulo period (<= 0 or greater than half the bus
bandwidth)

rows.Name: SMC_CGR_POSPERIOD_NOT_INTEGRAL
rows.Comment:
The modulo period in increments is not an integer, but the modulo-handling
is done by the drive.

rows.Name: SMC_FRACTION_TECH_UNITS_INVALID
rows.Comment:
The fraction describing the conversion between increments and technical
units is not initialized properly.  (Zero numerator or denumerator.)

rows.Name: SMC_SCALING_PARAMETERS_NOT_POSITIVE
rows.Comment:
The scaling parameters (increments per turn, gear settings, units in application)
must be all positive.

rows.Name: SMC_SCALING_SETTINGS_TOO_LARGE
rows.Comment:
The scaling parameters (increments per turn, gear settings, units in application)
are too large to fit into a fraction with 32 bit numerator and denominator.

rows.Name: SMC_MODULO_PERIOD_TOO_MANY_DIGITS
rows.Comment:
The modulo period has too many digits.  The modulo period times the denominator
of the fraction from user units to increments must be an integer.

rows.Name: SMC_P_FTASKCYCLE_EMPTY
rows.Comment: Axis contain no information on cycle time (fTaskCycle = 0).

rows.Name: SMC_R_NO_ERROR_TO_RESET
rows.Comment: There is no error to reset.

rows.Name: SMC_R_DRIVE_DOESNT_ANSWER
rows.Comment: An error occurred trying to acknowledge the drive error.

rows.Name: SMC_R_ERROR_NOT_RESETTABLE
rows.Comment: The drive error could not be reset.

rows.Name: SMC_R_DRIVE_DOESNT_ANSWER_IN_TIME
rows.Comment:
This error is no longer used and kept only for compatibility reasons.
See errorSMC_R_ERROR_NOT_RESETTABLE.

rows.Name: SMC_R_CANNOT_RESET_COMMUNICATION_ERROR
rows.Comment: A communication error cannot be acknowledged usingMC_Reset.  SeeSMC3_ReinitDrive.

rows.Name: SMC_RP_PARAM_UNKNOWN
rows.Comment: Parameter number unknown

rows.Name: SMC_RP_REQUESTING_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Error during transmission to the drives. See error number in
function block instanceReadDriveParameter.

rows.Name: SMC_RP_DRIVE_PARAMETER_NOT_MAPPED
rows.Comment: No assignment for drive parameters available

rows.Name: SMC_RP_PARAM_CONVERSION_ERROR
rows.Comment: Conversion of the value to / from the drive parameters failed.Unknown SoftMotion parameters

rows.Name: SMC_WP_PARAM_INVALID
rows.Comment: Parameter number unknown or writing not allowed

rows.Name: SMC_WP_SENDING_ERROR
rows.Comment: See error number in function block instanceWriteDriveParameter

rows.Name: SMC_WP_DRIVE_PARAMETER_NOT_MAPPED
rows.Comment: No assignment for drive parameters available

rows.Name: SMC_WP_PARAM_CONVERSION_ERROR
rows.Comment: Conversion of the value to / from the drive parameters failedUnknown SoftMotion parameters

rows.Name: SMC_H_AXIS_WASNT_STANDSTILL
rows.Comment: Axis was not in standstill state.

rows.Name: SMC_H_AXIS_DIDNT_START_HOMING
rows.Comment: Drive did not start homing.

rows.Name: SMC_H_AXIS_DIDNT_ANSWER
rows.Comment: Drive did not reply, when homing was done.

rows.Name: SMC_H_ERROR_WHEN_STOPPING
rows.Comment: Error at stop after homing. Deceleration may not be set.

rows.Name: SMC_H_AXIS_IN_ERRORSTOP
rows.Comment: Drive is in errorstop status. Homing cannot be executed.

rows.Name: SMC_H_SET_OP_MODE_HOMING_FAILED
rows.Comment: Drive could not be switched to homing mode.

rows.Name: SMC_H_CHECK_SET_OP_MODE_HOMING_FAILED
rows.Comment: Drive did not report that it is in homing mode.

rows.Name: SMC_H_PRE_HOMING_CHECKS_FAILED
rows.Comment: Pre homing checks failed.

rows.Name: SMC_MS_UNKNOWN_STOPPING_ERROR
rows.Comment: Unknown error at stop

rows.Name: SMC_MS_INVALID_ACCDEC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_MS_DIRECTION_NOT_APPLICABLE
rows.Comment: Direction = shortest not applicable

rows.Name: SMC_MS_AXIS_IN_ERRORSTOP
rows.Comment: Drive is in errorstop status. Stop cannot be executed

rows.Name: SMC_BLOCKING_MC_STOP_WASNT_CALLED
rows.Comment: Instance ofMC_Stopblocking the axis byExecute=TRUEhas not been called yet. MC_Stop (Execute=FALSE) has to be called.

rows.Name: SMC_MS_AXIS_ALREADY_STOPPING
rows.Comment: Cannot interrupt an ongoing MC_Stop

rows.Name: SMC_UNKNOWN_TASK_INTERVAL
rows.Comment: The task interval of the bus task could not be determined.

rows.Name: SMC_MA_INVALID_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalidvelocityoraccelerationvalues

rows.Name: SMC_MA_INVALID_DIRECTION
rows.Comment: Direction error

rows.Name: SMC_MR_INVALID_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalidvelocityoraccelerationvalues

rows.Name: SMC_MR_INVALID_DIRECTION
rows.Comment: Direction error

rows.Name: SMC_OVR_INVALID_OVERRIDE_FACTORS
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration or jerk override factor

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_AXIS_FORECAST
rows.Comment: Invalid (either negative or too large) axis forecast

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_FORECAST_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment: Axis does not support setting a forecast

rows.Name: SMC_MAD_INVALID_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalidvelocityoraccelerationvalues

rows.Name: SMC_MAD_INVALID_DIRECTION
rows.Comment: Direction error

rows.Name: SMC_MSI_INVALID_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_MSI_INVALID_DIRECTION
rows.Comment: Direction error

rows.Name: SMC_MSI_INVALID_EXECUTION_ORDER
rows.Comment: Except from aborting, donât call a major mvt-FB afterSMC_MoveSuperimposed

rows.Name: SMC_LOGICAL_NO_REAL_AXIS
rows.Comment: No longer used; only for compatibility

rows.Name: SMC_MV_INVALID_ACCDEC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_MV_DIRECTION_NOT_APPLICABLE
rows.Comment: Direction=shortest/fastestnot applicable

rows.Name: SMC_PP_ARRAYSIZE
rows.Comment: Erroneous array size

rows.Name: SMC_PP_STEP0MS
rows.Comment: Step time = t#0s

rows.Name: SMC_VP_ARRAYSIZE
rows.Comment: Erroneous array size

rows.Name: SMC_VP_STEP0MS
rows.Comment: Step time = t#0s

rows.Name: SMC_AP_ARRAYSIZE
rows.Comment: Erroneous array size

rows.Name: SMC_AP_STEP0MS
rows.Comment: Step time = t#0s

rows.Name: SMC_TP_TRIGGEROCCUPIED
rows.Comment: Trigger already active

rows.Name: SMC_TP_COULDNT_SET_WINDOW
rows.Comment: DriveInterface does not support the window function.

rows.Name: SMC_TP_COMM_ERROR
rows.Comment: Communication error

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_OUT_OF_RANGE
rows.Comment: The trigger number is not in the allowed range.

rows.Name: SMC_LATCH_IN_CONTROLLER_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
The mode latch in controller got deprecated and is
not supported anymore.

rows.Name: SMC_AT_TRIGGERNOTOCCUPIED
rows.Comment: Trigger already de-allocated

rows.Name: SMC_MCR_INVALID_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_MCR_INVALID_DIRECTION
rows.Comment: Invalid direction

rows.Name: SMC_MCA_INVALID_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_MCA_INVALID_DIRECTION
rows.Comment: Invalid direction

rows.Name: SMC_MCA_DIRECTION_NOT_APPLICABLE
rows.Comment: Direction = fastest not applicable

rows.Name: SMC_SDL_INVALID_AXIS_STATE
rows.Comment:
SMC_ChangeDynamicLimitsmay only be called in state standstill.
or power_off.

rows.Name: SMC_SDL_INVALID_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_SACF_INVALID_DYNAMIC_FACTOR
rows.Comment:
SMC_SetAdditionalConversionFactors: One of the factors has
an invalid value.

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_VELACCJERK_VALUES
rows.Comment: InvalidVelocity,Acceleration,Deceleration, orJerkvalues

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_DIRECTION
rows.Comment: InvalidDirection

rows.Name: SMC_CR_NO_TAPPETS_IN_CAM
rows.Comment: Cam does not contain any tappets.

rows.Name: SMC_CR_TOO_MANY_TAPPETS
rows.Comment: Tappet group ID exceedsMAX_NUM_TAPPETS

rows.Name: SMC_CR_MORE_THAN_32_ACCESSES
rows.Comment: More than 32 accesses on oneCAM_REF

rows.Name: SMC_CI_NO_CAM_SELECTED
rows.Comment: No cam selected

rows.Name: SMC_CI_MASTER_OUT_OF_SCALE
rows.Comment: Master axis out of valid range

rows.Name: SMC_CI_RAMPIN_NEEDS_VELACC_VALUES
rows.Comment:
Velocityandaccelerationvalues must be specified
forramp_infunction

rows.Name: SMC_CI_SCALING_INCORRECT
rows.Comment:
Scaling variablesfEditor/TableMasterMin/Maxare not
correct

rows.Name: SMC_CI_TOO_MANY_TAPPETS_PER_CYCLE
rows.Comment: Too many tappets became active during one cycle

rows.Name: SMC_CI_MORE_THAN_32_ACCESSES
rows.Comment: More than 32 accesses on oneCAM_REF

rows.Name: SMC_CI_MASTER_SYNC_POSITION_OUT_OF_SCALE
rows.Comment: MasterSyncPosition out of valid range

rows.Name: SMC_CI_AVOID_REVERSAL_FOR_FINITE_AXIS
rows.Comment:
InputAvoidReversalmust not be set for finite slave
axes.

rows.Name: SMC_CI_MASTERSTARTDISTANCE_MUST_BE_ZERO_BUFFERED
rows.Comment:
If BufferMode is not Aborting, then MasterStartDistance must
not be positive.

rows.Name: SMC_CI_CAM_CHANGED_DURING_RAMP_IN_DIST
rows.Comment:
The input CamTableId changed while ramping in with start
mode ramp_in_dist

rows.Name: SMC_CB_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
rows.Comment: Function block for the given cam format is not implemented

rows.Name: SMC_GI_RATIO_DENOM
rows.Comment: RatioDenominator= 0

rows.Name: SMC_GI_INVALID_ACC
rows.Comment: Accelerationinvalid

rows.Name: SMC_GI_INVALID_DEC
rows.Comment: Decelerationinvalid

rows.Name: SMC_GI_MASTER_REGULATOR_CHANGED
rows.Comment:
Master changed regulator state (on -> off or off -> on)
while coupling with slave was active.

rows.Name: SMC_GI_INVALID_JERK
rows.Comment: Jerkinvalid

rows.Name: SMC_PH_INVALID_VELACCDEC
rows.Comment:
Velocityandacceleration/decelerationvalues
invalid

rows.Name: SMC_PH_ROTARYAXIS_PERIOD0
rows.Comment: Rotation axis withfPositionPeriod= 0

rows.Name: SMC_MASTER_REGULATOR_CHANGED
rows.Comment:
Master changed regulator state (on -> off or off -> on)
while coupling with slave was active.

rows.Name: SMC_NO_CAM_REF_TYPE
rows.Comment: Type of given cam is not MC_CAM_REF.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_TABLE_DOES_NOT_COVER_MASTER_SCALE
rows.Comment:
Master area,xStartandxEnd, fromCamTableis
not covered by curve data.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_TABLE_EMPTY_MASTER_RANGE
rows.Comment: Cam data table has empty master range.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_TABLE_INVALID_MASTER_MINMAX
rows.Comment: Cam data master has invalid max-, min-values.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_TABLE_INVALID_SLAVE_MINMAX
rows.Comment: Cam data slave has invalid max-, min-values.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_INVALID_ELEMENT_COUNT
rows.Comment: The element count of the cam must be > 0.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_UNKNOWN_SEGMENT_TYPE
rows.Comment: Unknown cam segment type encountered.

rows.Name: SMC_SAFE_CAM_REF_ONLY_ONE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_AT_A_TIME
rows.Comment:
CAM_REF_MULTICORE_SAFE can only be accessed by 1 read or 1
write at a time.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_REF_INSUFFICIENT_MEMORY
rows.Comment:
The data array of MC_CAM_REF is too small to fit all cam
elements.

rows.Name: SMC_GIP_MASTER_DIRECTION_CHANGE
rows.Comment:
Obsolete: During coupling of slave axis, master axis has
changed direction of rotation.

rows.Name: SMC_GIP_SLAVE_REVERSAL_CANNOT_BE_AVOIDED
rows.Comment:
Obsolete: InputAvoidReversalis set, but slave reversal
cannot be avoided.

rows.Name: SMC_GIP_AVOID_REVERSAL_FOR_FINITE_AXIS
rows.Comment:
InputAvoidReversalmust not be set for finite slave
axes.

rows.Name: SMC_GIP_MASTERSTARTDISTANCE_MUST_BE_ZERO_BUFFERED
rows.Comment:
If BufferMode is not Aborting, then MasterStartDistance must
not be positive.

rows.Name: SMC_GIP_CANNOT_START_SYNC
rows.Comment:
The synchronisation cannot be started.  This can happen when GearInPos is commanded
as a buffered or blending movement and the master is in standstill when it becomes
active.

rows.Name: SMC_RAMP_IN_MASTER_DIRECTION_CHANGED
rows.Comment:
During coupling of slave axis, master axis has changed
direction of rotation.

rows.Name: SMC_RAMP_IN_SLAVE_REVERSAL_CANNOT_BE_AVOIDED
rows.Comment:
InputAvoidReversalis set, but slave reversal cannot be
avoided.

rows.Name: SMC_DCS_ON_OFF_COMPENSATION_REQUIRES_FORECAST
rows.Comment:
Using a negative On or OffCompensation requires setting a
forecast.

rows.Name: SMC_DCS_ON_OFF_COMPENSATION_EXCEEDS_FORECAST
rows.Comment:
The forecast must not be less than the maximum absolute value of all
negative On/OffCompensations.

rows.Name: SMC_DCS_SWITCHES_MUST_BE_ORDERED_BY_POSITION
rows.Comment: Switches on the same track must be ordered by position.

rows.Name: SMC_DCS_SWITCHES_MUST_NOT_OVERLAP
rows.Comment: Switches on the same track must not overlap.

rows.Name: SMC_DCS_INVALID_TRACK_NUMBER
rows.Comment: Switch has an invalid track number.

rows.Name: SMC_DCS_MAX_SWITCHES_PER_TRACK_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Maximum number of switches for a track exceeded.

rows.Name: SMC_DCS_SWITCH_POSITION_OUTSIDE_MODULO_PERIOD
rows.Comment:
At least one of the switches lies outside the modulo period
of the axis.

rows.Name: SMC_DCS_CAM_SWITCH_POINTER_NOT_SET
rows.Comment: TheSwitches.CamSwitchPtris not set.

rows.Name: SMC_BC_BL_TOO_BIG
rows.Comment: Gear backlashfBacklashtoo large (> position periode/2)

rows.Name: SMC_QPROF_DIVERGES
rows.Comment: Internal error: computation of quadratic trajectory failed

rows.Name: SMC_QPROF_INVALID_PARAMETER
rows.Comment: Internal error: computation of quadratic trajectory failed

rows.Name: SMC_QPROF_NO_RESULT
rows.Comment: Internal error: computation of quadratic trajectory failed

rows.Name: SMC_QPROF_INVALID_NEW_LBD
rows.Comment: Internal error: computation of quadratic trajectory failed

rows.Name: SMC_QPROF_BAD_NEGOTIATION
rows.Comment: Internal error: computation of quadratic trajectory failed

rows.Name: SMC_QPROF_INVALID_INTERVAL
rows.Comment: Internal error: computation of quadratic trajectory failed

rows.Name: SMC_QPROF_NOT_ENOUGH_PHASES
rows.Comment: Internal error: computation of quadratic trajectory failed

rows.Name: SMC_TG_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error: computation of quadratic trajectory failed

rows.Name: SMC_SRT_NOT_STANDSTILL_OR_POWEROFF
rows.Comment: Action only permitted instandstillorpower_off.

rows.Name: SMC_SRT_INVALID_RAMPTYPE
rows.Comment: Invalid ramp type

rows.Name: SMC_SMT_NOT_STANDSTILL_OR_POWEROFF
rows.Comment: Action only permitted instandstillorpower_off.

rows.Name: SMC_SMT_INVALID_MOVEMENTTYPE_OR_POSITIONPERIOD
rows.Comment: Invalid motion type or position period

rows.Name: SMC_SMT_AXIS_NOT_VIRTUAL
rows.Comment: Function block only applicable to virtual axis.

rows.Name: SMC_NO_LICENSE
rows.Comment: Target is not licensed for CNC.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_VEL_ZERO
rows.Comment: Path cannot be processed because setvelocity=0.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_NO_STOP_AT_END
rows.Comment: Last object of path has end velocity <> 0.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_DATA_UNDERRUN
rows.Comment: Warning: GEOINFO-List processed inDataInbut end of list not reached.Reason:EndOfListof the queue inDataInnot be setSMC_Interpolatorfaster than path generating function blocks

rows.Name: SMC_INT_VEL_NONZERO_AT_STOP
rows.Comment: Velocity at Stop > 0

rows.Name: SMC_INT_TOO_MANY_RECURSIONS
rows.Comment: Too muchSMC_Interpolatorrecursions. SoftMotion error

rows.Name: SMC_INT_NO_CHECKVELOCITIES
rows.Comment:
SMC_CheckVelocitiesis not the last processed function
block, that accesses to the OutQueue-data bypoqDataIn.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_PATH_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Internal or numeric error

rows.Name: SMC_INT_VEL_ACC_DEC_ZERO
rows.Comment:
Velocityandacceleration/decelerationis null
or to low

rows.Name: SMC_INT_DWIPOTIME_ZERO
rows.Comment: FB called withdwIpoTime=0

rows.Name: SMC_INT_JERK_NONPOSITIVE
rows.Comment: Jerkinvalid becausejerkmust be positive

rows.Name: SMC_INT_QPROF_DIVERGES
rows.Comment:
Internal error. Computation of the quadratic velocity
profile does not converge.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_INVLALID_VELOCITY_MODE
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity mode

rows.Name: SMC_INT_TOO_MANY_AXES_INTERPOLATED
rows.Comment:
More than the allowed number of axes has been interpolated.
You are using a restricted version.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_DEGENERATE_SEGMENT
rows.Comment:
The segment is numerically degenerate: It is very short and
at the end of the queue. It should be ignored.

rows.Name: SMC_HIGH_CURVATURE_SPLINE
rows.Comment:
Computation of interpolation point failed because the curvature of the spline is too high.
Try changing the path to avoid sharp corners.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_PROBE_ACKNOWLEDGED_WHILE_MOVING
rows.Comment:
A probe (G31) must not be acknowledged while the interpolator is moving.  Stop the interpolator first,
using the inputs bSlow_Stop, bQuick_Stop, or bEmergency_Stop.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_PROBE_NOT_ACKNOWLEDGED
rows.Comment: A probe (G31) has not been acknowledged.

rows.Name: SMC_INT_PROBE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
An internal error ocurred while acknowledging the probe
(G31).

rows.Name: SMC_INT2DIR_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL
rows.Comment:
Warning:poqDataInofOutQueueis created too small.
Adherence of stops not guaranteed.

rows.Name: SMC_INT2DIR_PATH_FITS_NOT_IN_QUEUE
rows.Comment: Path does not go completely in queue.

rows.Name: SMC_XINT_INVALID_DIRECTION
rows.Comment: Direction input has an invalid value.

rows.Name: SMC_XINT_NOINTERSECTION
rows.Comment:
Could not determine position on CNC path for the given
x-position.

rows.Name: SMC_WAR_INT_OUTQUEUE_TOO_SMALL
rows.Comment:
Warning:poqDataInofOutQueueis created too small.
Adherence of stops not guaranteed

rows.Name: SMC_WAR_END_VELOCITIES_INCORRECT
rows.Comment: Warning: Final velocities inconsistent

rows.Name: SMC_CV_ACC_DEC_VEL_NONPOSITIVE
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_CA_INVALID_ACCDEC_VALUES
rows.Comment: Invalid velocity, acceleration, deceleration, or jerk values

rows.Name: SMC_TOK_INCOMPLETE_TOKEN_AT_END_OF_INPUT
rows.Comment:
The input has been exhausted, but there is still an
unfinished token

rows.Name: SMC_TOK_NOT_A_VALID_TOKEN
rows.Comment: The input does not match any token type

rows.Name: SMC_TOK_AMBIGUOUS_INPUT
rows.Comment: The input is ambiguous, it could be more than one token type

rows.Name: SMC_TOK_STRING_TOO_LONG_FOR_TOKEN

rows.Comment:
CP-Tracking: Cannot keep the path;
try to reduce the dynamics on the path and / or the dynamics when entering CP-Tracking.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_CONTINUE_WRONG_POSITION
rows.Comment:
Current position does not allow continuation.  When continuing in a dynamic
coordinate system (e.g. in a PCS that is following a rotary table), this error
might be caused by not having used SMC_GroupUpdateContinueData.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_CONTINUE_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL
rows.Comment:
Buffer in continueData is too small;
big external movement-queue-buffer in use.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_CONTINUE_WRONG_CHECKSUM
rows.Comment:
The checksum stored in the continue data is wrong.
The continue data either was not written by MC_GroupInterrupt,
or was modified afterwards.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_IDLE_WAIT_AXES_MOVING
rows.Comment:
Commanded SMC_GroupWait while axes were moving
independently from the axis group (single axis movement or similar).

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_INVERSE_TRAFO_EXCEEDING_POSLIMITS
rows.Comment:
Inverse transformation lead to axis values exceeding the
configured limits.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_CANNOT_ADD_SAME_AXIS
rows.Comment: Prohibit adding the same axis to an axis group twice

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_TRANSFORMATION_NOT_SET
rows.Comment: No transformation is set.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_NON_RESUMABLE_ERROR
rows.Comment:
The path cannot be resumed after the current axis group
error.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_CONTINUE_DATA_NOT_WRITTEN
rows.Comment:
The continue data for MC_GroupContinue has not been written correctly.
(MC_GroupInterrupt not called / non-resumable axis group error)

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_INVALID_INTERRUPT_POSITION
rows.Comment: The commanded interrupt position is invalid.

rows.Name: SMC_RELATIVE_MOVEMENT_TRACKING_CS
rows.Comment:
The commanded relative movement is not supported.
Its start position (end position of preceding movement) and distance are given
in two different coordinate systems (CS) with at least one being dynamic

rows.Name: SMC_RELATIVE_MOVEMENT_ABORTING_TRACKING
rows.Comment:
The commanded relative movement is not supported.
It is Aborting and aborts a
- track-in (from a static CS to a dynamic CS),
- track-out (from a dynamic CS to a static CS) or
- re-track (from a dynamic CS to another dynamic CS) movement.

rows.Name: SMC_CIRCULAR_MOVEMENT_TRACKING_CS
rows.Comment:
The commanded circular movement is not supported.
Its start position (end position of preceding movement) and target
position are given in two different coordinate systems (CS) with at
least one being dynamic.

rows.Name: SMC_CIRCULAR_MOVEMENT_ABORTING_TRACKING_CS
rows.Comment:
The commanded aborting circular movement is not supported.
Its start position (current position) and target position are given in two
different coordinate systems (CS) with at least one being dynamic, or
the aborted movement is PTP tracking.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_CONTINUE_POSITION_WRONG_CHECKSUM
rows.Comment:
The checksum of the continue position is wrong.
The continue position either was not written by MC_GroupInterrupt,
was modified afterwards, or an online change was executed when the
continue position was still in use.
Please note: The checksum is only checked when the continue position
cannot be expressed as a constant value, because it changes with time
(e.g. when a track in movement should be continued).

rows.Name: SMC_CIRCULAR_TRACKING_TOOL_CHANGE_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
A circular movement with a tool change is only supported in a static
coordinate system.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_COULD_NOT_WRITE_CONTINUE_DATA
rows.Comment:
Continue data could not be written.  This can happen when
trying to write continue data while moving to another continue
position.

rows.Name: SMC_MODULO_AXIS_FOR_NON_ROTARY_JOINT
rows.Comment:
A modulo axis is not allowed for joints of the kinematics
that are not rotary.

rows.Name: SMC_MODULO_AXIS_FOR_LIMITED_ROTARY_JOINT
rows.Comment:
A modulo axis is not allowed for rotary joints that have a limited
range. (The range comes from the kinematic transformation.)

rows.Name: SMC_MODULO_AXIS_PERIOD_NOT_360
rows.Comment:
A modulo axis for a rotary joint must have modulo period
360.

rows.Name: SMC_FB_WASNT_CALLED_DURING_EXECUTION
rows.Comment: The FB was not called for at least one cycle

rows.Name: SMC_NO_EVALUATION_POSSIBLE_FOR_TIME_OFFSET
rows.Comment: The value could not be evaluated for the given time offset.

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_SOURCE_TYPE_FOR_TIME_OFFSET
rows.Comment:
Values with time offset can only be evaluated for source
type set.

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_TIME_OFFSET
rows.Comment: Invalid time offset. Must be >=0.

rows.Name: SMC_TIME_OFFSET_TOO_LARGE
rows.Comment:
The time offset is too large (larger than the forecast
duration, see SMC_TuneCPKernel.fPlanningForecastDuration).

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_NUM_ADDITIONAL_AXES_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
More than the maximum number of additional axes where added to the axis group.
The maximum number of additional axes can be increased by changing the library
parameterMAX_NUM_ADDITIONAL_AXES``in``SM3_CPKernelDefaults.

rows.Name: SMC_INVALID_COORD_SYSTEM_FOR_TIME_OFFSET
rows.Comment:
Values with time offset cannot only be evaluated for this
coordinate system.

rows.Name: SMC_KERNEL_PTP_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the kernel

rows.Name: SMC_KERNEL_PTP_INVALID_TASKCYCLETIME
rows.Comment: Task cycle time not positive

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_INVALID_PARAMETERS
rows.Comment: The parameter values of the transformation are invalid.

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_INVALID_CONSTELLATION
rows.Comment:
The requested position is outside of the working area of the
transformation.

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_INVALID_COUPLING
rows.Comment:
The orientation part cannot work together with the position part of
the kinematics.
Either, the position part doesnât implement ISMPositionKinematics2,
or the orientation cannot deal with the position partâs image of
orientations.

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_NOT_INITIALIZED
rows.Comment:
The FB implements ISMKinematicWithInitialization, but hasnât been
Initialized yet.

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_NO_TOOL_WITH_OFFSET_ALLOWED
rows.Comment:
Special error for positioning part of Kin_4Axis_Palletizer,
which implements ISMPositionKinematics_Offset2, but cannot
actually cope with offsets <> 0.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_TOOL_OFFSET_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_KINEMATICS
rows.Comment:
The configured tool offset is not compatible with the
kinematics used

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_INVALID_AXIS_LIMITS
rows.Comment:
The configured position limits of one or more axes are not
valid for the kinematics.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_PATH_DEVIATION_TOO_HIGH
rows.Comment:
This error code has been replaced by SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_AXIS_LAG_EXCEEDED,
SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_POSITION_LAG_EXCEEDED and SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_ORIENTATION_LAG_EXCEEDED.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_POSITION_EXCEEDS_POSLIMITS
rows.Comment:
The given axis position exceeds the position limits of an
axis.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_NO_DYNAMIC_MODEL_CONFIGURED
rows.Comment: No dynamic model has been configured for the axis group.

rows.Name: SMC_DYNAMICS_NUM_TORQUES_NEQ_NUM_AXES
rows.Comment:
The number of torques returned by the dynamic model is different from the
number of axes.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_AXIS_LAG_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
The axis lag is higher than the allowed tolerance.
When tracking is used, this indicates that the tracked object is accelerating/
decelerating too quickly for the robot to follow.
SeeSMC_SetPathTolerance.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_POSITION_LAG_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
The position lag of the TCP is higher than the allowed tolerance.
When tracking is used, this indicates that the tracked object is accelerating/
decelerating too quickly for the robot to follow.
SeeSMC_SetPathTolerance.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_ORIENTATION_LAG_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
The orientation lag of the TCP is higher than the allowed tolerance.
When tracking is used, this indicates that the tracked object is accelerating/
decelerating too quickly for the robot to follow.
SeeSMC_SetPathTolerance.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CACHE_FULL
rows.Comment: The cache of the CP planner is too small.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_EVAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
The evaluation of the position on a path element failed
(internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_NON_CONTINUABLE_STATE
rows.Comment: Non-continuable state reached (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_MAX_LENGTH_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Maximum trajectory length exceeded (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ACCELERATION_TOO_HIGH
rows.Comment: Path acceleration too high (invalid state, internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_MAX_ITERATIONS_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Maximum number of iterations exceeded (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_NO_TRAJECTORY
rows.Comment: No trajectory could be computed (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_OUT_QUEUE_FULL
rows.Comment: The out-queue is full (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_QUEUE_UNDERRUN
rows.Comment:
The computation of the trajectory could not be performed in real time.
The fill level of the sync buffer between the planning task and the bus
task was too low.Possible reasons:The task configuration of the planning task is not set correctly.
Please see the online help chapter âDiagnosis of Problems with
Movementsâ for good settings.The performance of the PLC is not sufficient.
Possible measures to avoid the error:use a separate, dedicated CPU core for the planning taskincrease the bus task intervalincrease the planning interval and/or the sync buffer
duration usingSMC_TuneCPKernelThe current fill level of the sync buffer can be monitored using
theCurrentSyncBufferDurationouptput ofMC_GroupReadStatus.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_QUEUE
rows.Comment: Invalid queue (invalid size or pointer)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_BLENDING_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: An internal error occurred while blending two CP movements

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_COLLINEAR_POINTS
rows.Comment: The three points that define the circle are collinear.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_CENTER_NOT_ON_BISECTOR
rows.Comment:
The center point is not on the perpendicular bisector of the
start and end point.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_RADIUS_ZERO
rows.Comment: The radius is zero

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_DISTANCE_LARGER_THAN_DIAMETER
rows.Comment:
The distance between start and end point is larger than the diameter.
(When trying to create a circle usingSMC_Circ_Mode.Radius.)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_START_AND_ENDPOINT_EQUAL
rows.Comment:
The start and end point are equal
(SMC_Circ_Mode.Radius).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_BLENDING_DEGENERATE_SPLINE
rows.Comment: The blending spline is degenerate (too short or non-regular)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ELEMENT_TOO_SHORT
rows.Comment: The path element cannot be created because it is too short.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_COULD_NOT_CUT_PATH
rows.Comment:
The path could not be cut for aborting movement (internal
error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ANGULAR_VEL_ACC
rows.Comment:
The given angular velocity or acceleration is invalid (quaternion with
non-zero real part, internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ORIENTATION
rows.Comment:
The given orientation is invalid (non-orthonormal matrix or non-unit
quaternion, internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TIME_BUDGET_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
The given time budget for the computation is exceeded
(internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_AXIS_LIMIT_VIOLATED
rows.Comment:
A limit of an axis has been violated.  This can happen if a CP movement
is done too close to a singularity or if the path has a very high curvature.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CONFIGS_DIFFER
rows.Comment:
The kinematic configuration of the start position differs from
the end position.  The CP movement would pass a
singularity.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_BUS_TASK_NOT_CALLED
rows.Comment:
This error is obsolete and is maintained only for compatibility.
If a CP-halt/-stop is commanded, some information has to be
transferred to the bus task. We expect this to happen
before the next cycle of the slow task.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_NO_ROOT_IN_INTERVAL_FOUND
rows.Comment:
The stop trajectory could not be found in the interval.
(internal error)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_KIN_DOES_NOT_SUPPORT_AXIS_ORIENTATION_IPO
rows.Comment:
The kinematics does not support the orientation mode
âAxisâ for continuous path movements.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_ORIENTATION_IPO_NOT_SUPPORTED_FOR_CPTR
rows.Comment:
The axis orientation interpolation mode is not supported
for CP movements with a dynamic PCS (tracking).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_PATH_ELEM
rows.Comment: An invalid path element has been created (internal error)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TRANSITION_NOT_SMOOTH
rows.Comment:
The transition between two path elements is not G2 continuous,
and there is no stop (internal error)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_ORIENTATION_IPO_CONFIG_DIFFERS
rows.Comment:
Axis orientation interpolation mode is used, but between
the start end end position, there is a singularity of the
position kinematics.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_ORIENTATION_IPO_OFFSET2_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
rows.Comment:
The position kinematics has configurations but does not
implement the interface ISMPositionKinematics_Offset2.
In this case, axis orientation interpolation is not
possible.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ROTARY_AXIS_PERIOD_MISMATCH
rows.Comment:
The target position of a rotary axis will not be reached
in the commanded period.
(E.g. the commanded target position
is -170Â°, but the target will be reached with position 190Â°
instead.)
This means that the chosen interpolation to the target position
is not compatible with the commanded position.
For PTP movements (MC_MoveDirect*), this error can happen if
the previous movement is a CP movement (MC_MoveLinear*,
MC_MoveCircular*), and if the CP movement is very long.
To avoid the problem, the CP movement should be divided
into two or more shorter movements.  The problem can occur
if a rotary axis has to move 360Â° or more during the CP
movement.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ROTARY_AXIS_RANGE_VIOLATION
rows.Comment:
A rotary axis has violated the allowed axis range during
a CP movement.  The CP movment is not in the working area.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_COMPUTE_TARGET_DISCONTINUITY
rows.Comment:
The target trajectory could not be computed due to a
discontinuity of the end position (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TRAJECTORY_NOT_SMOOTH
rows.Comment:
The trajectory is not smooth, the phase end states do not
equal the the current state (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ERROR_CREATING_PARAM_TRANSFORM
rows.Comment:
A parameter transformation could not be created (internal
error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_PTP_DATA_NUMBER_OF_AXES
rows.Comment:
Error generating path-invariant PTP element (internal
error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_NEGATIVE_PATH_VELOCITY
rows.Comment:
Error while computing a new trajectory: the path velocity after
phase 1 (positive jerk of length dTau1) is negative (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TRANSITIONING_FROM_SINGLE_AXIS_MOVEMENT_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
Transitioning from a single axis movement to a continuous path
movement is not supported.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_PLANNER_NO_PROGRESS
rows.Comment:
The CP-planner did not make any progress.  This is an internal error
That can be triggered by very sharp corners (e.g. blending between
short elements or with small corner distance).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INTERNAL_EVAL_CACHE_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the evaluation cache of the CP-planner.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ROOT_ACC_TOO_HIGH
rows.Comment:
The acceleration at the trajectory end is too high for a
valid root (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ROOT_TRAJECTORY_TOO_LARGE
rows.Comment:
The stop trajectory is too large. Reduce the velocity or
increase the acceleration and jerk limits.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_EMPTY_TRAJECTORY
rows.Comment:
The trajectory is empty, i.e. has no phases (internal
error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_FORECAST_TOO_LARGE
rows.Comment:
The forecast duration is too large given the configured planning
interval and sync buffer duration.
To avoid this error, either reduce the forecast duration, reduce the
sync buffer duration, or increase the planning interval.  See SMC_TuneCPKernel
for more details.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ROOT_ENDPOS_NOT_GREATER_STARTPOS
rows.Comment:
The end position of the trajectory is not greater than the
start position (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_VELOCITY_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_WHITHOUT_MOVING
rows.Comment: Axis velocity limit exceeded whithout moving on the path.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_ACCELERATION_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_WHITHOUT_MOVING
rows.Comment:
Axis acceleration limit exceeded whithout moving on the
path.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_JERK_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_WHITHOUT_MOVING
rows.Comment: Axis jerk limit exceeded whithout moving on the path.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_TORQUE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_WHITHOUT_MOVING
rows.Comment:
Axis torque/force limit exceeded whithout moving on the
path.

rows.Name: SMC_GROUPJOG2_MAX_DISTANCE_NON_POSITIVE
rows.Comment:
Either MaxLinearDistance or MaxAngularDistance of
SMC_GroupJog2 is non-positive.

rows.Name: SMC_GROUPJOG2_DYNAMIC_CS_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
SMC_GroupJog2 does not support jogging in dynamic coordinate
systems.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_TOO_MANY_TRIGGERS_PREPARED
rows.Comment: Too many triggers have been prepared for the next movement.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_UNSUPPORTED_MOVEMENT_TYPE
rows.Comment:
Triggers for wait commands and for halt/stop commands are
not supported.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_INVALID_POS_TYPE
rows.Comment: The given trigger position type is not valid.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_RELATIVE_POSITION_OUT_OF_RANGE
rows.Comment: The relative trigger position must be in the range [-1, 1].

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PLANE_NORMAL_NOT_A_UNIT
rows.Comment: The normal vector for a trigger plane must be a unit-vector.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PLANE_DISTANCE_NEGATIVE
rows.Comment: The distance of the trigger plane must be non-negative.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PLANE_COORD_SYSTEM_INVALID
rows.Comment:
The coordinate system of the trigger plane must not be ACS
or TCS.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_DISTANCE_OUT_OF_RANGE
rows.Comment:
The trigger distance must be in the range [-len, len], where len
is the length of the movement.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PLANE_NO_INTERSECTION
rows.Comment: No intersection between the trigger plane and the movement.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_TRACKING_TRANSITION_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
Triggers not supported for tracking movements between different
coordinate systems.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PTP_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
Triggers with position type MvtDistance and PlaneInstersection are
not supported for PTP movements.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_FULL
rows.Comment: The cam builder is full. No new cam segments can be added.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INVALID_MASTER_DISTANCE
rows.Comment: The master distance of a cam segment must be > 0.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_GAP_BETWEEN_SEGMENTS
rows.Comment:
The new segment does not connect to the master end position
of the previous segment.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_NO_IMPLICIT_LEFT_BOUNDARY_ALLOWED
rows.Comment:
No implicit left boundary allowed, because the last segment
has an implicit right boundary.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INVALID_IMPLICIT_CAM_SEGMENT_MASTER_DISTANCE
rows.Comment:
x0 of the new segment results in a master distance <=0 for
the previous implicit segment.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_CAM_REF_INSUFFICIENT_MEMORY
rows.Comment:
The cam builder has more segments than the MC_CAM_REF can
store.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_LAST_SEGMENT_HAS_IMPLICIT_RIGHT_BOUNDARY
rows.Comment: The last segment has an implicit right boundary.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INVALID_CAM_REF_INITIALIZATION
rows.Comment:
MC_CAM_REF init error, due to a null pointer to the cam
segments.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_ERROR_PENDING
rows.Comment:
The data of the cam builder cannot be written to the
MC_CAM_REF, because an error is pending.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_CONTINUITY_REQUIREMENT_VIOLATED
rows.Comment:
The continuity check of the cam builder detected a violated
continuity requirement.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_MASTER_DISTANCE_TOO_SHORT
rows.Comment: The master distance of the cam segment is too short.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_IMPLICIT_CAM_SEGMENT_DISTANCE_TOO_SHORT
rows.Comment:
The master distance of the previous implicit segment is too
short.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_CAM_REF_INVALID_ARRAY_SIZE
rows.Comment:
Array size is limited to 32767 SMC_CAM_SEGMENT entries and
must be a multiple of this data type.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_MODIFIED_SINE_INVALID_LAMBDA_OR_ACC_PARAM
rows.Comment:
The given lambda or acceleration parameter Ca* of this
segment is invalid.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_MODIFIED_SINE_ACC_PARAM_RIGHT_BOUND_IMPLICIT
rows.Comment:
A modified sine segment defined by the acceleration
parameter Ca* must not have an implicit right boundary.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INVALID_COMPILE_TYPE
rows.Comment: MC_CAM_REF has an unsupported compile type.

rows.Name: SMC_MOVEMENT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in a movement.

rows.Name: SMC_MOVEMENT_GET_POS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while trying to get a position in a movement.

rows.Name: SMC_CPTR_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the CPTR kernel.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_IPO_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while interpolating in the CP kernel.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ADD_NEW_MOVEMENT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while adding a new movement to the CP kernel.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_COORDINATION_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while coordinating kernels.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_ADD_MOVEMENT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while adding movements to the axis group.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_READ_AXIS_STATES_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Internal error while reading the state of one of the groupâs
axes.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_READ_VEL_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while trying to read the velocity.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_READ_ACC_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while trying to read the acceleration.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_INVALID_STATE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error: The axis group is in an invalid state.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_PCS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while handling a PCS.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_INTERRUPT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: An internal error occured during an interrupt.

rows.Name: SMC_CONTINUE_DATA_READ_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while reading continue data.

rows.Name: SMC_CONTINUE_DATA_WRITE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while writing continue data.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in a path element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_ESTIMATE_LIMITS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Internal error while estimating the limits of a path
element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_ZERO_LEN_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in a zero-length path element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_BLEND_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in a blending element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_BLEND_GEO_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the geometric part of a path element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_BLEND_ORI_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the orientation part of a path element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_BLEND_AS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in an axis space element.

rows.Name: SMC_ELEM_FUN_CART_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in an element function.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_HALT_STOP_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error during cp halt or stop.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_INIT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while initializing trajectory planning.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_GEN_SAMPLES_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while generating samples.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_PATH_OUT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while creating the output path.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_EVAL_AXIS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while evaluating axis values.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_LOOKAHEAD_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in planning lookahead.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_READ_JERK_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while trying to read the jerk.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_WRITE_CONTINUE_POS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while writing the continue position.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TRANSITION_CHECK_FAILED
rows.Comment:
Internal error while checking whether the path is
continuous.

rows.Name: SMC_ABORTING_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while aborting.

rows.Name: SMC_LINE_TO_REL_STANDSTILL_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while creating a line to relative standstill.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_POSE_EVAL_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while evaluating a pose on a path element.

rows.Name: SMC_CS_REF_COUNT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in coordinate system reference counting.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_QUEUE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the path queue.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_QUEUE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the path queue.

rows.Name: SMC_ELEM_FUN_QUEUE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the element function queue.

rows.Name: SMC_MAC_DUPLICATE_CALLER_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Internal error in the multi acyclic communicator due to a
duplicate SDO caller.

rows.Name: SMC_MAC_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the multi acyclic communicator.
